Module Overview

Splunk Mule Connector

Summary

Configuration
<splunk:config>
Configure an instance of this module
Message Sources
<splunk:run-export-search>
Run an export search, which streams results

<splunk:run-normal-search>
Run a normal search, which polls for completion.
<splunk:run-real-time-search>
Run a realtime search and process the response returns via a sourcecallback

Message Processors
<splunk:add-data-to-index>
Add data to an index without an input, using HTTP to submit a string

<splunk:add-data-to-tcp-input>
Add data to a Tcp Input

Creates an Index with optional arguments

Run a saved search with run-time arguments

<splunk:view-saved-search-properties>
View the properties of the saved search

Configuration

To use the this module within a flow the namespace to the module must be included. The resulting flow will look similar to the following:

<mule xmlns="http://www.mulesoft.org/schema/mule/core"
      xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
      xmlns:splunk="http://www.mulesoft.org/schema/mule/splunk"
      xsi:schemaLocation="
               http://www.mulesoft.org/schema/mule/core
               http://www.mulesoft.org/schema/mule/core/current/mule.xsd
               http://www.mulesoft.org/schema/mule/splunk
               http://www.mulesoft.org/schema/mule/splunk/current/mule-splunk.xsd">

      <!-- here goes your flows and configuration elements -->

</mule>

This module is configured using the config element. This element must be placed outside of your flows and at the root of your Mule application. You can create as many configurations as you deem necessary as long as each carries its own name.

Each message processor, message source or transformer carries a config-ref attribute that allows the invoker to specify which configuration to use.

Attributes
TypeNameDefault ValueDescriptionJava TypeMIME TypeEncoding
xs:string name Optional. Give a name to this configuration so it can be later referenced.
xs:string host The Splunk Host
xs:string port The Splunk Port

Connection Pool

This connector offers automatic connection management via the use of a connection pool. The pool will act a storage mechanism for all the connections that are in-use by the user of this connector.

Prior to execution of a processor, the connector will attempt to lookup an already established connection and if one doesn't exists it will create one. That lookup mechanism is done in the connection pool via the use of connection variables declared as keys.

The user of the connector can configure the pool by adding a connection-pooling-profile to the connector configuration like this:

    <splunk:connection-pooling-profile maxActive="10" maxIdle="10"
                             exhaustedAction="WHEN_EXHAUSTED_GROW" maxWait="120" minEvictionMillis="60000" evictionCheckIntervalMillis="30000"/>

The following is a list of connection attributes, each connection attribute can be configured at the config element level or they can also be added to each processor. If they are used at the processor level they get the benefit of full expression resolution.

Connection Attributes
NameDefault ValueDescriptionJava TypeMIME TypeEncoding
config-ref Optional. Specify which configuration to use.
username A username String */* UTF-8
password A password String */* UTF-8

Reconnection Strategies

Reconnection Strategies specify how a connector behaves when its connection fails. You can control how Mule attempts to reconnect by specifying a number of criteria:

  • The type of exception
  • Number and frequency of reconnection attempts
  • The notifications generated, and more

With a reconnection strategy, you can better control the behavior of a failed connection, by configuring it, for example, to re-attempt the connection only once every 15 minutes, and to give up after 30 attempts. You can also send an automatic notification to your IT administrator whenever this reconnection strategy goes into effect. You can even define a strategy that attempts to reconnect only during business hours. Such a setting can prove useful if your server is frequently shut down for nightly maintenance.

Configuration

A reconnection strategy that allows the user to configure how many times a reconnection should be attempted and how long to wait between attempts.

    <splunk:config>
         <reconnect count="5" frequency="1000"/>
    </splunk:config>
Reconnect Attributes
NameDefault ValueDescription
frequency 2000 Optional. How often (in ms) to reconnect
count 2 Optional. How many reconnection attempts to make

For more information about reconnection strategies in Mule, or even how to write your own custom reconnection strategy please check this section.

Message Processors

<splunk:add-data-to-index>

Add data to an index without an input, using HTTP to submit a string

XML Sample
<splunk:add-data-to-index indexName="#[payload.indexName]" stringData="#[payload.stringData]">
    <splunk:index-args ref="#[payload.index-args]"/>
</splunk:add-data-to-index>

Attributes
NameDefault ValueDescriptionJava TypeMIME TypeEncoding
config-ref Optional. Specify which configuration to use.
indexName The name of the index to update String */* UTF-8
stringData The data string to send String */* UTF-8
Connection Parameters
This are only required if you didn't specified them at the configuration element. They are also useful for overriding the values of the configurations or even if you need to extract them from the Mule message since they support expression evaluation.
username Optional. A username String */* UTF-8
password Optional. A password String */* UTF-8
Child Elements
NameDefault ValueDescriptionJava Type
<splunk:index-args> Optional. Optional map of arguments to apply to the update Map<String, Object>
Returns
Return Type Description
Map<String, Object> The index that has been updated

XML Sample

Attributes
NameDefault ValueDescriptionJava TypeMIME TypeEncoding

This are only required if you didn't specified them at the configuration element. They are also useful for overriding the values of the configurations or even if you need to extract them from the Mule message since they support expression evaluation.
username Optional. A username String */* UTF-8
password Optional. A password String */* UTF-8
Returns
Return Type Description
Boolean Success or Failure
Exception Payloads
Payload ClassDescription

<splunk:clean-index>

Clean the index, which removes all events from it

XML Sample
<splunk:clean-index indexName="#[payload.indexName]" maxSeconds="#[payload.maxSeconds]"/>

Attributes
NameDefault ValueDescriptionJava TypeMIME TypeEncoding
config-ref Optional. Specify which configuration to use.
indexName The name of the index to clean String */* UTF-8
maxSeconds 180 Optional how long to wait, -1 is forever (not recommended on a Connector). Default is 180s int */*
Connection Parameters
This are only required if you didn't specified them at the configuration element. They are also useful for overriding the values of the configurations or even if you need to extract them from the Mule message since they support expression evaluation.
username Optional. A username String */* UTF-8
password Optional. A password String */* UTF-8
Returns
Return Type Description
Map<String, Object> the cleaned index

</splunk:create-saved-search>

Attributes
NameDefault ValueDescriptionJava TypeMIME TypeEncoding

searchQuery The query String */* UTF-8
Connection Parameters
This are only required if you didn't specified them at the configuration element. They are also useful for overriding the values of the configurations or even if you need to extract them from the Mule message since they support expression evaluation.
username Optional. A username String */* UTF-8
password Optional. A password String */* UTF-8
Child Elements
NameDefault ValueDescriptionJava Type
<splunk:search-args> Optional. A Map of Key-Value Arguments for the saved search. See the Splunk documentation for details. Map<String, Object>
Returns
Return Type Description
Map<String, Object> a map of the SavedSearch object that can then be executed

<splunk:run-blocking-search>

Runs a blocking search, which will wait for completion on the splunk server and return synchronously.

XML Sample
<splunk:run-blocking-search searchQuery="#[payload.searchQuery]">
    <splunk:search-args ref="#[payload.searchArgs]"/>
</splunk:run-blocking-search>

Attributes
NameDefault ValueDescriptionJava TypeMIME TypeEncoding
config-ref Optional. Specify which configuration to use.
searchQuery The search query String */* UTF-8
Connection Parameters
This are only required if you didn't specified them at the configuration element. They are also useful for overriding the values of the configurations or even if you need to extract them from the Mule message since they support expression evaluation.
username Optional. A username String */* UTF-8
password Optional. A password String */* UTF-8
Child Elements
NameDefault ValueDescriptionJava Type
<splunk:search-args> Optional. The map of search arguments, described in the splunk documentation. Map<String, Object>
Returns
Return Type Description
Map<String, Object> the results as a list of hashmaps
Exception Payloads
Payload ClassDescription
SplunkConnectorException when the search cannot execute

<splunk:run-one-shot-search>

Run a basic oneshot search and display results NOTE: XML output appears to be the only supported type right now.

XML Sample
<splunk:run-one-shot-search searchQuery="#[payload.searchQuery]"
                                earliestTime="#[payload.earliestTime]" latestTime="#[payload.earliestTime]">
        <splunk:args ref="#[payload.args]"/>
</splunk:run-one-shot-search>

Attributes
NameDefault ValueDescriptionJava TypeMIME TypeEncoding
config-ref Optional. Specify which configuration to use.
searchQuery The search query String */* UTF-8
earliestTime The earliest time String */* UTF-8
latestTime The latest time String */* UTF-8
Connection Parameters
This are only required if you didn't specified them at the configuration element. They are also useful for overriding the values of the configurations or even if you need to extract them from the Mule message since they support expression evaluation.
username Optional. A username String */* UTF-8
password Optional. A password String */* UTF-8
Child Elements
NameDefault ValueDescriptionJava Type
<splunk:args> Optional. Optional map of arguments to pass to the search. Map<String, String>
Returns
Return Type Description
List<Map<String, Object>> The XML results of the search, parsed into a List of Hashmaps
Exception Payloads
Payload ClassDescription
SplunkConnectorException when an error occurs communicating with Splunk

XML Sample

Attributes

Returns
Return Type Description

<splunk:run-saved-search-with-arguments>

Run a saved search with run-time arguments

XML Sample
<splunk:run-saved-search-with-arguments searchName="#[payload.searchName]">
        <splunk:custom-args ref="#[payload.customArgs]" />
        <splunk:search-dispatch-args ref="#[payload.searchDispatchArgs]" />
</splunk:run-saved-search-with-arguments>

<splunk:run-export-search>

Run an export search, which streams results

XML Sample
<splunk:run-export-search searchQuery="#[payload.searchQuery]" earliestTime="#[payload.earliestTime]" latestTime="#[payload.latestTime]">

</splunk:run-export-search>

Attributes
NameDefault ValueDescriptionJava TypeMIME TypeEncoding
config-ref Optional. Specify which configuration to use.
searchQuery The search query to run String */* UTF-8
earliestTime -1h The earliest time to search from, default is -1h String */* UTF-8
latestTime now The latest time to search to, default is now String */* UTF-8
callback The SourceCallback to stream results to SourceCallback */*

This are only required if you didn't specified them at the configuration element. They are also useful for overriding the values of the configurations or even if you need to extract them from the Mule message since they support expression evaluation.

<splunk:run-normal-search>

Run a normal search, which polls for completion. Results will be streamed via a SourceCallback.

XML Sample
<splunk:run-normal-search searchQuery="#[payload.searchQuery]">
    <splunk:search-args ref="#[payload.searchArgs]"/>
</splunk:run-normal-search>

Attributes
NameDefault ValueDescriptionJava TypeMIME TypeEncoding
config-ref Optional. Specify which configuration to use.
searchQuery The search Query String */* UTF-8
searchCallback The SourceCallback used to dispatch messages when a response is received SourceCallback */*
Connection Parameters
This are only required if you didn't specified them at the configuration element. They are also useful for overriding the values of the configurations or even if you need to extract them from the Mule message since they support expression evaluation.
username Optional. A username String */* UTF-8
password Optional. A password String */* UTF-8
Child Elements
NameDefault ValueDescriptionJava Type
<splunk:search-args> Optional. The search properties Map<String, Object>
Exception Payloads
Payload ClassDescription
SplunkConnectorException when the search cannot execute

<splunk:run-real-time-search>

Run a realtime search and process the response returns via a sourcecallback

XML Sample
<splunk:run-real-time-search searchQuery="#[payload.searchQuery]" earliestTime="#[payload.earliestTime]" latestTime="#[payload.latestTime]" statusBuckets="#[payload.statusBuckets]" previewCount="#[payload.previewCount]" />

Attributes
NameDefault ValueDescriptionJava TypeMIME TypeEncoding
config-ref Optional. Specify which configuration to use.
searchQuery The query to run in realtime String */* UTF-8
earliestTime rt The start time for the realtime search String */* UTF-8
latestTime rt The latest time for the realtime search String */* UTF-8
statusBuckets 300 The status buckets to use - defaults to 300 int */*
previewCount 100 The number of previews to retrieve - defaults to 100 int */*
callback The SourceCallback to capture the response SourceCallback */*
Connection Parameters
This are only required if you didn't specified them at the configuration element. They are also useful for overriding the values of the configurations or even if you need to extract them from the Mule message since they support expression evaluation.
username Optional. A username String */* UTF-8
password Optional. A password String */* UTF-8
Exception Payloads
Payload ClassDescription
SplunkConnectorException when there is a problem setting up the runtime search
